intro: Siphocampylus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white or greenish in color. Siphocampylus cubensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
